snippet: The pact is part of an effort by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration to improve safety practices in the auto industry.
abstract: Mark Rosekind, head of National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, announces deal with 18 automakers to share and analyze safety data in order to 'find and fix defects before someone gets hurt;' executives from car makers endorse list of voluntary proactive safety principles, which include developing plan to ward off digital attacks on vehicles.
lead_paragraph: The pact is part of an effort by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration to improve safety practices in the auto industry.

headline.main: 18 Carmakers Agree to Share Safety Data
headline.print_headline: U.S. and 18 Carmakers Agree to Share and Jointly Analyze Safety Data
